results.title: Australian balance of payments
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of the School of Business Studies at Melbourne College of Advanced Education, presents this detailed examination of Australia’s Balance of Payments. Covers concepts involved: components of the Balance of Payments, recent trends and problems and implications for management of the economy.

results.title: Australian Army at war
results.brief_description: A film telling the story of the Australian Army’s part in the fighting on world battle fronts, from the outbreak of war in 1939 until the surrender of Japan. It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.
results.description: A film telling the story of the Australian Army’s part in the fighting on world battle fronts, from the outbreak of war in 1939 until the surrender of Japan. It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.

It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian animals
results.brief_description: Shows a wide variety of Australian animals in their natural habitat, including the spiny anteater, koala, wombat, emu, platypus, lizards, parrots and cockatoos. No narration.

results.title: Australian achievement
results.brief_description: This film showcases the production of McPherson’s “Macson” lathe featuring footage of a production line in a Holden car plant, the launch of a P.J. Adams of London ship, and sections of the power grid. Provides a detailed explanation of lathe production, including footage of the research laboratory undertaking improvement in design right up to the point of the final stage of lathes being packed for export.
results.description: This film showcases the production of McPherson’s “Macson” lathe featuring footage of a production line in a Holden car plant, the launch of a P.J. results.title: Australian Aborigines: songs and dances
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the Sydney University’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land. This film shows the musical instruments of the Aborigines and contrasts the songs and dances of different tribes. The story behind every song and dance is told by the commentator.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Modern social studies”.

results.title: Australian aborigines: police tracker
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Explains how Jackie the full blooded aboriginal police tracker from Katherine learnt this skill, which enables the aboriginal to hunt and the police to keep law and order and to save lives in Australia’s outback. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land and produced in collaboration with Professor A.P. Elkin, Professor of Anthropology, University of Sydney.

Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land this film shows how Aborigines live on native animals and plants.
